intro: Telis spinosa, commonly known as the spiny telis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, blooming during the warmer months. Telis spinosa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with features such as reduced leaf surface and thick, waxy cuticles to minimize water loss. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
